thread.title: LIVE: BSE Sensex, NSE Nifty open on a flat note; healthcare stocks up
thread.title_full: LIVE: BSE Sensex, NSE Nifty open on a flat note; healthcare stocks up | The Financial Express

author: financialexpress.com
title: LIVE: BSE Sensex, NSE Nifty open on a flat note; healthcare stocks up
text:
The BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty opened on a flat note on Friday following global cues.
The key benchmark indices BSE Sensex opened 28.98 points higher at 28,327.11. The NSE Nifty opened 7.85 points lower at 8,580.80.
10.30 am: BSE Sensex was trading 0.05 per cent lower at 28,284. NSE Nifty was at 8,589.20.
9.58 am: Shares of Vedanta, Tech Mahindra and NMDC were trading 2.21 per cent, 1.58 per cent and 1.41 per cent higher at Rs 129.40, Rs 542.35 and Rs 104.10, respectively, in the early trade. NSE Nifty was at 8589.20 at the same time.
9.51 am: Macquarie says India is now a stock picker’s market due to mixed macro conditions and rising flows in mutual funds, which are expected to participate in midcaps.
9.33 am: the BSE Sensex and NSE Nifty were trading 0.04 per cent lower at 2,8285 and 8,584.90, respectively.
Shares of healthcare, metal and oil & gas were trading in positive zone in the early trade.
BHEL, M&M, Tata Motors, Grasim Industries, Rural Electrification Corporation, Neyveli Lignite, Aptech, Corporation Bank, Gateway Distriparks, Gujarat State Petronet and Kalpataru Power will be declaring their results for the quarter ended June 30 later today.
On Thursday, the key benchmark index BSE Sensex gained 75 points, or 0.27 per cent, to 28,298.13. The NSE Nifty index also gained 20.70 points, or 0.24 per cent, to 8,588.65.
Global Markets
US: The Dow Jones industrial average on Thursday fell 0.69 percent to end at 17,419.75 and the S&P 500 lost 0.78 percent to 2,083.56. The Nasdaq Composite dropped 1.62 percent to 5,056.44, its biggest one-day tumble since early July.
London: Britain’s top share index edged down on Thursday, weighed down by weakness in miners and insurer RSA, though it briefly rallied off lows after a broadly dovish update from the Bank of England. The FTSE 100 index ended down 5.32 points, or 0.1 percent lower at 6,747.09 points, turning slightly lower after a negative open on Wall Street.
Tokyo: Japan’s Nikkei share average edged down on Friday as investors took profits from recent high flyers such as drugmakers, railways and retailers ahead of U.S. jobs data due later in the day.
The Nikkei average dipped 0.3 percent to 20,610.18 while the broader Topix fell 0.4 percent to 1,667.65, though it is still up 0.5 percent so far this week.
Hong Kong: The Hang Seng Index was up 0.85 percent.
(With inputs from agencies)
First Published on August 07, 2015 9:23 am © The Indian Express Online Media Pvt Ltd
